variants.Description in input context: c.2316C>T (p.T772M) in the TERT gene, a missense mutation in the catalytic domain leading to reduced telomerase activity.

Material used.Material Name: Fibroblasts from patients with TERT c.2316C>T and control fibroblasts
Material used.Description: Telomere length was measured in fibroblasts from patients with the TERT c.2316C>T mutation and control fibroblasts.

Readout description.Result Description: Patients with the TERT c.2316C>T mutation exhibited significantly shorter telomeres compared to control fibroblasts.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each group.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Control fibroblasts from unaffected individuals were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Fibroblasts with no TERT mutations were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare telomere lengths between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Telomere length within 1 standard deviation of control samples.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Telomere length reduced by ≥20% compared to control samples.

Material used.Material Name: Fibroblasts from patients with TERT c.2316C>T and control fibroblasts
Material used.Description: TERT protein levels were assessed in fibroblasts from patients and controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Western blot analysis showed decreased TERT protein levels in patients with the TERT c.2316C>T mutation.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each group.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Control fibroblasts were used as positive controls for TERT expression.

Basic negative control.Description: Fibroblasts with no TERT mutations were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to compare TERT expression levels between groups.

Material used.Material Name: Fibroblasts from patients with TERT c.2316C>T and control fibroblasts
Material used.Description: Telomerase activity was measured in fibroblasts from patients and controls.

Readout description.Result Description: Telomerase activity was significantly lower in patients with the TERT c.2316C>T mutation compared to controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each group.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Control fibroblasts were used as positive controls for telomerase activity.

Basic negative control.Description: Fibroblasts with no TERT mutations were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare telomerase activity between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Telomerase activity within 1 standard deviation of control samples.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Telomerase activity reduced by ≥30% compared to control samples.
